intro: Tanacetum cadmeum, commonly known as the Greek tansy, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-green composite flowers that bloom in late summer. Native to southern Europe and parts of the Middle East, this plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. It is often found in dry grasslands and rocky areas, where it contributes to the ecological diversity of its habitat. The plant has a long history of use in traditional medicine and as a natural insect repellent.
